isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - CLUTCH HOUSING

note.para: The procedure is the same for aluminum or cast iron mountings.

step1.para: Position a new gasket on the housing mounting surface.

caution.para: If you replace the clutch housing, DO NOT replace it with one machined before January 1, 1995. It will not have the proper countershaft bearing relief machined into the countershaft bearing pockets and could cause interference between the countershaft bearings and clutch housing.

note.para: The input bearing cover must be installed before you install the clutch housing.

step1.para: Install the clutch housing on the six (6) studs on the main case, piloting it on the front input bearing cover.

note.para: Cast iron clutch housings use split-type lockwashers. Aluminum clutch housings use a flat washer with the nut and star-type lockwashers with the bolts.

step1.para: Install the nuts with washers or lockwashers on the studs, and tighten to 224 to 271 Nm (180 to 200 ft-lbs).
Apply Loctite 242 to the bolts and install them with lockwashers. Tighten the bolts to 98 to 108 Nm (72 to 80 ft-lbs).

note.para: The torque value is the same for aluminum or cast iron housings.
